greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n,k) is the number of ways to choose integers i,j from {0,1,...,k} such that the inequality |i-j|<= n <= i+j is satisfied.
comment: a(n,k) is also the number of independent rank n tensor operators to appear in the tensor product of two spaces each spanned by k+1 tensor operators of ranks 0 to k,
Basis elements of the tensor product space of are given by
for all l,l'=0,1,...,k and where p=|l-l'|,|l-l'|+1,...,l+l' is the rank, q=-p,-p+1,...,p and where C^{ll'p}_{mm'q} are the Clebsch-Gordon coefficients.
link: Eliahu Cohen, Tobias Hansen, Nissan Itzhaki, From Entanglement Witness to Generalized Catalan Numbers, arXiv:1511.06623 [quant-ph], 2015.
maple: Seq:=[]: for k from 0 to 15 do for n from 0 to k do Seq:= [op(Seq), -(3/2)*n^2+2*k*n+(1/2)*n+k+1] end do; for n from k+1 to 2*k do Seq:= [op(Seq), (1/2)*(2*k-n+1)*(2*k-n+2)] end do; end do; Seq;
results.author: _Sean Murray_, Apr 27 2010
